info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:07PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Warren, southeastern Mercer and southwestern Henry Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 206 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burgess, or 10 miles southeast of Aledo, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burgess, Viola, Woodhull, Alpha, North Henderson, Lake Warren, New Windsor, Alexis, Coldbrook, Gerlaw, Griffin and Cameron. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 32 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm will be capable of producing a quick 1 to 2 inches of rainfall as it moves through.
